refnamediv.refpurpose: Decodes data encoded with MIME base64

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: base64_decode decodes encoded_data and returns the original data. The returned data may be binary.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: base64_encode returns data encoded with base64. This encoding is designed to make binary data survive transport through transport layers that are not 8-bit clean, such as mail bodies.
Base64-encoded data takes about 33% more space than the original data.
See also: base64_decode, chunk_split, RFC2045 section 6.8.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Parse a URL and return its components

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function returns an associative array returning any of the various components of the URL that are present. This includes the "scheme", "host", "port", "user", "pass", "path", "query", and "fragment".

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns a string in which the sequences with percent (%) signs followed by two hex digits have been replaced with literal characters. For example, the string foo%20bar%40baz decodes into foo bar@baz.
